column10: Speeding truck driver turning left off Potomac Ave/27th St  nearly hit me as I turned right onto Crystal Dr.  I was already in intersection as he sped into it, plus I had right of way anyway

construction is blocking sidewalk and bike lanes , buses aer parked there blockign view of pedestrians crossing 15th street. car making right onto hayes cannot see people because of costco construction no sidewalks, no visibilty

column10: Driver had blocked the bike lane in order to wait for their companion who was inside the Amazon Fresh store nearby. I was unwilling to merge into general car traffic because I had my child with me on my cargo bike, and it was dark and rainy. If the bike lane was actually protected, as it purports to be, this would have been impossible. Arlington needs to fix their bike lanes.
column21: Bike lanes are merely feel-good parking spaces, except to the extent that cars are physically prevented from accessing them. Build protected bike lanes or admit that they're window dressing.

column10: Due to the ongoing construction in the area, all of the crosswalks and sidewalks at this intersection are fully out of commission. There is no way to cross the street from any direction in a safe manner, so pedestrians are now jaywalking and using the single lane road as a sidewalk (the section of 15th St S between S Eads St and Jefferson Davis Highway) which is high-traffic. There is also a closed lane in this section of street that is under construction (with many holes and dangerous hazards) that people are using to duck out of the way when cars come speeding down the single lane road. Before the crosswalks and sidewalks were closed, I have almost been hit crossing this intersection multiple times over the past year (walking this path daily) while having the right-of-way by drivers speeding through right turns on red. Now, I see multiple people every day almost get hit by these cars or injured from having to walk in the construction zones. It is extremely dangerous.

While crossing the street from south to north, a driver came from south fern making an unprotected left without pausing to see if we were in the intersection. He was driving a red sedan and came within inches of me and my partner.

I was traveling southbound on Crystal Drive when a Ride Share driver stopped and pulled into the bike lane to pick up a passenger causing me to slam on the breaks. Additionally, cars traveling behind the ride share were impacted and harassed the driver enough that they moved out of the lane into a emergency vehicle spot.
